books.title: Medieval Archer
books.notes: Medieval Archer is a great book to start reading about Archery from a historical point of view.

books.title: Toxophilus - The School of Shooting, in Two Books
books.notes: Toxophilus is a book written by Roger Ascham, first published in 1545, for Henry VIII's court; it's the first Book about archery written in English. The Book offers a  detailed look at the archery of Henry VIII's time and is a massively helpful read. The Book is difficult to read due to the antiquated language.

books.title: With a Bended Bow: Archery in Medieval and Renaissance Europe
books.notes: It is a great book that looks into the history, Industry, and skills of archery of medieval and later periods.

books.title: The Witchery of Archery: a Complete Manual of Archery
Richard Head Longbows - `HOW TO MAKE` Arrows playlist
Wolfram Bows
books.notes: Wolfram Bows is a company that makes 'reeactment bows' (low poundage), they are always very high quality, with excellent customer service.

books.title: Details about  A Practical guide to making Longbow Arrows
books.notes: This Booklet is both a great read and quick reference book that makes a great starting point, some self-published works can be like rolling a dice, but this one is worth the small cost.

books.title: MEDIEVAL ARCHERS BODY TRANSFORMATION
books.notes: a great video show some of the changes found the bodys of archers found.

books.title: The Craft Guild of Traditional Bowyers & Fletchers
